meanings.definition: To sing with frequent changes from the ordinary voice to falsetto and back again.
meanings.sent1: She yodelled beautifully during the performance, showcasing her vocal range.
meanings.sent2: The Swiss singer yodelled at the top of the mountain, echoing through the valley.
meanings.sent3: As she yodelled, the cows in the meadow seemed to pause and listen.
meanings.sent4: His voice yodelled like a bird soaring high in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The old man yodelled a tune that brought tears to the eyes of all who heard.

meanings.sent1: He yodelled loudly to call his dog back home.
meanings.sent2: The mountaineer yodelled to communicate with his fellow climbers.
meanings.sent3: The child yodelled in excitement when she found her lost toy.
meanings.sent4: The yodelling echoed through the canyon, reaching far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy yodelled a greeting as he rode into town.

meanings.definition: To sing in a manner reminiscent of a yodel.
meanings.sent1: The singer yodelled softly, adding a unique touch to the song.
meanings.sent2: In the distance, a shepherd yodelled to his flock on the hillside.
meanings.sent3: The cat yodelled along with the opera singer on TV, creating a funny duet.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter yodelled through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The wind yodelled through the trees, creating a haunting melody.
